Class ClientSide.Chat

java.lang.Object
ClientSide.Component
ClientSide.Chat
Enclosing class:
ClientSide
public class ClientSide.Chat extends ClientSide.Component
Represents a chat component in a graphical user interface, extending ClientSide.Component. This class creates and manages a chat interface. It handles user interactions for sending messages and updating chat history, as well as sending and receiving chat messages to and from the server.

  • Constructor Details

    • Chat

      public Chat(int x, int y, int cWidth, int cHeight, Color bgColor, Color borderColor, int radius)
      Constructs a Chat component with specified location, dimensions, colors, and border styling. It initializes the chat component's UI elements.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the chat component.
      y - the y-coordinate of the chat component.
      cWidth - the width of the chat component.
      cHeight - the height of the chat component.
      bgColor - the background int of the chat component.
      borderColor - the border int of the chat component.
      radius - the radius of the border corners.

  • Method Details

    • drawComponent

      public void drawComponent()
      Initializes the UI components and draw the Chat.
      Overrides:
      drawComponent in class ClientSide.Component

    • send

      public void send()
      Sends the current message from the message input field to the server if the field is not empty.

    • update

      public void update(String input)
      Updates the chat history area with a new message received from the server.
      Parameters:
      input - the input string containing the message type, sender username, and message text.

    • allowChat

      public void allowChat(boolean allowance)
      Allows or disallows sending messages in the chat by disabling/enabling the UI components.
      Parameters:
      allowance - true to enable chat functionalities, false to disable them.

    • isChatAllowed

      public boolean isChatAllowed()
      Checks if chatting is currently allowed.
      Returns:
      true if chat is allowed, otherwise false.
